poem:
Title: War's Transubstantiation 

Upon the veil of morning, violence hammers,
Painter in the heavy strokes of discontent.
Echoes of affliction trample godly chambers,
In Damascus, a consulate's whisper is rent.
Beirut's child, Zahedi, meets his marble demise,
In death's cold embrace, the warrior undisguised.
Yet, from injustice, humanity rises,
In war's transubstantiation, life, heartbroken, defies.
